0.description:
Add drop-in support for making a Gatsby site work offline and more resistant to bad network connections using the gatsby plugins for the same. 

It creates a service worker for the site and loads the service worker into the client.
0.impact: Faster access to the ers-hcl site
0.name: Add PWA and Offline support to Gatsby based ers-hcl website.

1.description: Use the XLS source plugin to pull the data  Create a new react page component (Automatically just like the blog posts)  Pull date from xls via graphQL  Display table as a separate page
1.name: Add support for Excel files based auto generated pages in Gatsby (HCL ERS Github static generated site)

2.description: While we do display the organization stats, it will be great to see the top rated projects across languages and per language. Add the same functionality to the gatsby ers-hcl static site generator. Extract the details using the github graphql apis for the same.
2.name: Add support for github top ten projects based on star rating

3.description:
There is an excellent POC on how Angular Elements can be used to create a Microfrontend app as described in this article

http://www.softwarearchitekt.at/post/2018/05/04/microservice-clients-with-web-components-using-angular-elements-dreams-of-the-near-future.aspx

The concept
•	Create a App Shell (This is the Skelton on the app which has the header, footer , menu  etc. Probably hold some state as well
•	Each view is a separate web component . You can say a separate app itself (but as a web component)
•	Web components will interact via Input/Output events with the shell , that will coordinate with all the other web components

Explore the POC and extend further
3.impact: Web component base architecture is the next major technology required for future projects
3.name: Angular Elements based Microfrontend

4.description:
Build a web application using either Angular, Vue , React
Use a live GraphQL server or mock 
Demonstrate state management using Apollo-link-state
4.impact: GraphQL based UI integration is a key future technology
4.name: Apollo-link-state based app

5.description: While Typescript is a great transcompiler + Typesafe language should we be considering this over Babel ES6/7 when building React applications. Consider all aspects in building , maintaining and extending performant React applications .. which do you think is better suited ? Prove this via a project which creates a sample app using both these transcompilers and then present your POV..
5.impact: The decision of choosing Typescript over Flow / Babel has implications of cleaner , potentially less compile time errors vs productivity. On a case to case basis decide on what is more applicable.
5.name: Babel ES6/7 vs Typescript for React Application

6.description: Write a generic script which can build a binary classifier when the predictors and response variable are provided. The script should be able to select the best parameters based and build the model. A scoring function should also be provided which outputs the result on an unseen dataset. Language used R or Python
6.name: Binary Classifier

7.description:
Build a web application based on DRY principles and use a web component library approach
Use any web framework of your choice Angular, Vue , React
Implement the sample using the BitSrc framework
7.name: BitSrc based component library

8.description: Generating use cases from Data. Customers say we have data but do not know what to do with it.  An example is understanding behavior of a device from available data, say the distribution of data changes from one month to another indicating that something has happened to the device. Developing visualization libraries to find out such candidates can be useful.
8.name: Building Visualization libraries to find use cases from data.

9.description: As IOT and Big Data become popular, applications which can filter out the odd candidates without user input on big data scale, can become useful.   For example, from a set of identical devices, if an application can find the outliers without user intervention, that can be useful.
9.name: Building a visualization plugin to find outliers.

10.description: Create a project to demonstrate the advantage of using CSS-in-JS . For this exercise use the Emotion framework along with React JS and Babel  Emotion is a performant and flexible CSS-in-JS library. Building on many other CSS-in-JS libraries, it allows you to style apps quickly with string or object styles. It has predictable composition to avoid specificity issues with CSS. With source maps and labels, Emotion has a great developer experience and great performance with heavy caching in production.  https://emotion.sh/
10.name: CSS-in-JS Emotion / React Sample

12.description:
This challenge is to prepare a starter project for the Elastic Stack. At present, users have to install and configure each of the components of the stack.  
The starter project will achieve the following 
- Single downloadable package. 
- One step installation. 
- Pre-configured components. 
- A basic working 'hello world' example.
12.name: Centralized Logging: Starter project for Elastic Stack

13.description: The Elastic stack had three primary components. Each of these is independent in itself. They can be combined with other tools to achieve Centralized logging. This challenge is for studying alternates available for these components.   - Study alternates for Logstash - Study alternates for Elasticsearch - Study alternates for Kibana
13.name: Centralized Logging: Study alternates of Elastic stack Components

14.description:
This is a spring boot graphQL server project initially based on the excellent post by Issam GUISSOUMA  
 
While the initial setup is based on the article , the idea of this project is to make it a comprehensive graphQL sample based on SpringBoot 2 Items to be covered  
 
Comprehensive documentation and tests Add samples for NoSQL databases 
 
Add more complete ORM relationships backed by graphQL Add sample for external APIs Add Reactive Extensions
14.impact: Good reference of building Java based GraphQL implementations
14.name: Comprehensive SpringBoot GraphQL Server

15.description: Create a Babel / Flow based version of nxplorerJS . While Typescript is a great alternative for building node based microservices .  The Babel transcompiler is much high in compliance to the ES6/7 API standards . This will provide an option for building a pure Java script solution. It will also provide us an opportunity to do a benchmark of the Babel vs Typescript version
15.name: Create a Babel / Flow based version of nxplorerJS

16.description: Create an artifact which can create a Rest Service that can be used for Calling a machine learning model built in R or Python.
16.name: Data Science Engineering

17.description:
Today, there is a distinct need of Data Quality assessment which is to identify whether a data project can be undertaken. Task here would be to write scripts/ programs which can identify problems ( and possibly propose solutions to improve) and declare whether use cases can be supported or not. Things like skewness. Sampling, sufficiency of data are some of the things which can be thought about.  Ideally a report should be published and shared with the stakeholder who wants the data to be audited.

High level outputs are as below:

Executive Summary
Outlier
Skewness
Kurtosis
Compatible with Machine Learning 
Sampling
Probable use cases
Sampling 
Category Counts 
Null Counts
17.name: Data Quality Assessment

18.description:
Manufacturing analytics 
– Manufacturing processes use lot of charts like control charts, pareto charts for process control.  
Developing these artefacts with open source Visualization libraries can be useful and used as accelerators.
18.name: Developing Manufacturing process charts

19.description: Environment Management scripts that can automate the common infra management tasks using shell / python / ansible. Ex: manage tomcat tasks.
19.impact: reusable templates for common infra tasks.
19.name: Environment Management automation scripts

20.description:
- Easy Setup , Writing and Run . Ability various steps of the web app 
- Waits for dynamic content 
- Mobile responsiveness testing 
- API based widget control 
- Waiting for results 
- Control network requests 
- Test edge cases or when server is down 
- Time travel of the application state 
- Cypress is more developer-centric and TDD friendly as compared to Selenium
20.name: Explore Cypress.io as a Selenium/Protractor alternative

21.description: Storybook is a development environment for UI components. It allows you to browse a component library, view the different states of each component, and interactively develop and test components. https://storybook.js.org/   This is available for React , Vue and Angular and comes with a huge list of add-ons to help create a UI library style guide as well as an important tool in the web application development toolkit.
21.name: Explore Storybook for UI component development - Angular

22.description: Storybook is a development environment for UI components. It allows you to browse a component library, view the different states of each component, and interactively develop and test components. https://storybook.js.org/  This is available for React , Vue and Angular and comes with a huge list of add-ons to help create a UI library style guide as well as an important tool in the web application development toolkit.
22.name: Explore Storybook for UI component development - React

23.description: This is available for React , Vue and Angular and comes with a huge list of add-ons to help create a UI library style guide as well as an important tool in the web application development toolkit. https://storybook.js.org/
23.name: Explore Storybook for UI component development - Vue

24.description:
There is new an emerging web framework with is claimed to be faster than even PreactJS. This is been developed by the EmberJS test. 
There are a lot of exciting features like shippable web components, fastest rendering engine , typescript support, ssr ready. 
What needs to be done 
- Explore GlimmerJS 
- Build a complete GlimmerJS based application (Proper CSS, Theme, State management, tests)  https://glimmerjs.com
24.name: Glimmer.js app validating its performance and features

25.description: Enhance one of the nxplorerJS projects to add support for GraphQL Prisma
25.name: GraphQL + Prisma (Convert DB to a GraphQL Server)

26.description:
Creating an end to end Graphql based solution is challenging . This is where we can use LaunchPad https://github.com/apollographql/launchpad  
- Create or use an existing GraphQL LaunchPad 
- Create a Web app in the framework of your choice 
- Utilize the apollo client / link state for graphql data and state management on the UI side 
- Ensure completeness with unit tests and code coverage
26.name: GraphQL LaunchPad + Web App Solution

27.impact: Need to invest in serverless solutions. Currently no capability
27.name: GraphQL Serverless support

28.description: Since the graphql API will at the max return results of 100 repositories at a time for an organization and we need to this to be done during compile time we cannot use pagination to get more results (otherwise we will need the API token and there are rate limits)
28.name: Handling of github graphql API results in Gatsby (where repo count > 100)

29.description: Infrastructure as code IAC Ocean for physical , virtual, cloud and containerized environments
29.name: Infrastructure as code IAC Ocean

30.description: Kubernets deployment scripts needs to be enabled for smooth deployment of docker enabled Microservices
30.impact: Good show case project for ops dashboard
30.name: K8S enablement to be done for smooth deployment of Microservices

31.description: Build a web application using either Angular, Vue , React  Use appropriate libraries and demonstrate loading of large datasets in a table view  The data should be via an API or a json file
31.name: Large Data Set Visualization

32.description:
Drastically reduce the amount of boiler plate code required by the developer when building Java based microservices.
Advantage - 30-40% code reduction, better code coverage , cleaner and maintainable code , reduced errors and better exception handling

Reference: https://projectlombok.org
32.name: Lombok for high developer productivity for Java Developers by 30-40%

33.description: MQ based integration layer will be created to help communication between different interfaces.This will be configurable and can use either ActiveMQ, IBM MQ and any MQ provider.Both the Interfaces can exchange messages in sync/async way.
33.name: MQ based integration between interfaces

34.description: Angular 5 based sample app which implements material design
34.impact: Material Design system is an important system to have capability in.
34.name: Material Design app using NG

35.description: Presentation and styling plays an important presenting any idea or POC. Use the standard material-ui kit to create an app (could be anything from a shopping app to a music listing etc.)
35.name: Material-ui-kit based React/Angular/Vue webApp

36.description:
Micrometer provides abstraction to metrics integration. Think of it as SLF4J , but for metrics
It is already built into the RabbitMQ Java Client.By abstracting away and supporting multiple monitoring systems under common semantics, the tool makes switching between different monitoring platforms quite easy

For SpringBoot 2, Micrometer is autoconfigured by Actuator and OOTB
In SpringBoot 1 - it has been backported to Spring 1.5.

Create a POC on Micrometer integration with Prometheus,Atlas and JMX

References: https://www.infoq.com/presentations/micrometer
http://www.baeldung.com/micrometer
36.name: Micrometer for Microservice Monitoring

37.description: An effort to create a micro-services starter collection based on various tools/frameworks available in market. viz.  ** In Progress   Spring Boot  Tomcat  Jetty  Grizzly  Netty  JBoss Undertow  Wildfly Swarm ** ToDo   NodeJS
37.name: Microservice Challenge : Starter

39.description: Implement Microservice Starter based on Undertow and add support for •Packaging •Deployment

40.name: Microservice Challenge : Starter - Jetty

42.description: Implement Microservice Starter based in Spring Boot and add support for  Packaging Deployment
42.name: Microservice Challenge : Starter - Spring Boot

43.description: Implement Microservice Starter based in Tomcat and add support for  Launcher Packaging Deployment
43.name: Microservice Challenge : Starter - Tomcat

45.description:
For ID verification, the captured documents are sent to the server for further processing. The server components will handle image processing, data extraction using OCR and stores the digitized results in the database for future. 
This project aims at doing pre-validation of the selected images. 
 ## Plan 
The preliminary checks which can be done on the mobile device include the checking of  
- Image Resolution (200dpi) 
- Face Detection 
- Image Size (5KB to 10MB) 
- Image Clarity 
- Image Format.
45.name: Mobility Challenge : Offline ID document validation - iOS

46.description:
Template designer - Allows to upload/capture sample document image and mark the field area and tag them as property. 
Allowed field types: 
- Text 
- Image 
- Barcode 
- QR Code 
- MRZ  
## Plan 
- Designer allows uploading/capturing sample ID document 
- Show controls to mark text field, mark image, mark QR code, mark MRZ, mark Barcode, add field label/legend to the marked area
46.name: Mobility Challenge: Mobile document template designer

47.description:
Building a document template engine capable of parsing the image template schema and overlay input controls on the mobile camera screen.  
## Plan 
- Document template recognition module to the Mobile app to validate the ID document while scanning it using the mobile camera.  
- The document template schema can be synced from the server periodically.  
- The schema can have the number of the fields, position (approximate relative x, y coordinates) of the fields, type of the fields, etc.
47.name: Mobility Challenge: Mobile document template engine

48.description:
For ID verification, the captured documents are sent to the server for further processing. The server components will handle image processing, data extraction using OCR and stores the digitized results in the database for future. 
This project aims at doing pre-validation of the selected images.  
## Plan The preliminary checks which can be done on the mobile device include the checking of  
- Image Resolution (200dpi) 
- Face Detection 
- Image Size (5KB to 10MB) 
- Image Clarity 
- Image Format.
48.name: Mobility Challenge: Offline ID document validation - Android

49.description:
The ngrx-data library is one way to stay on the ngrx path while radically reducing the boilerplate necessary to manage entities with ngrx.  https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-ngrx-data  
This project requires prior knowledge of Redux and NGRX   
The project involves  
1) A practical experiment using ngrx-data 
2) Review this with using the bare bones version of ngrx-data  
The POC **MUST** provide an detailed analysis of what the findings are and if/when will you recommend using ngrx-data
49.name: NGRX Data + Angular 5 POC and Review

50.description:
NGXS - a redux-style state management system for Angular

NGXS is modeled after the CQRS pattern popularly implemented in libraries like Redux and NGRX but reduces boilerplate by using modern TypeScript features such as classes and decorators.
50.name: NGXS state management alternative to ngrx

51.description:
Build a web application using Angular5  Use the Nx extensions, more that one router, ngrx, component library, standard css.  
Demonstrate re-usability
51.impact: Mono repo will help organize larger projects and increase reusability
51.name: Nx based Angular App

52.description:
Build a PWA using either Angular, Vue , React  
The app should demonstrate creating an application link , caching of content , offline , api access and fall back , push notifications  
The lighthouse score should be > 90
52.name: PWA using FE of your choice

53.description:
- Select any popular web property or web app 
- Perform a detailed performance evaluation using tools like lighthouse webpagetest , chrome dev tools 
- Classify the findings and give suggestions for fixing the issues - Demonstrate with POCs
53.name: Performance Evaluation Report

54.description:
Build a web application using Preact 
- The application must access an API for data , perform some business logic , have more than one route , use standards based styling 
- Do a detailed performance using tools like lighthouse and webpagetest
54.name: Preact web app

55.description:
•	Guess.js uses machine learning and predictive analytics to do pre-fetching and loading of pages and data for web apps
•	Data Driven user experiences
•	This works with React and Angular 
•	In a SPA app – prefetch pages , prefetch individual resources for pages using guess.js . Only prefetching if the network can handle it.
•	No more experimenting or doing this using trial and error

Create a POC on React / Angular / Gatsby to explore this
55.name: Predictive Analytics driven Web Performance using Guess.js

56.description:
The ERS-HCL project challenges will be maintained in a table , the table data will be saved on Firebase  
The application will provide an editable view of the data of each challenge and also provide CRUD and filter operations on the following fields:  ChallengeID Description of Challenge Contributor Domain Priority RepositoryID
56.impact: Good show case for material design, react , firebase , oauth, complex data table implementation
56.name: Project Challenge Tracker Data Table

57.description:
Build a web application using React 
- Use a live GraphQL server or mock  
- Demonstrate state management using React Relay
57.name: React Relay based app

58.description:
PageDraw (Beta) is an exciting tool which helps take care of the complex UI component generation with functional code. 
Explore pagedraw.io and see what level of productivity can be gained using this along with either React or Angular
58.name: ReactJS or Angular + PageDraw.io (Rapid UI Development)

59.description:
Spring 5 has recently gone GA and there is a lot of buzz about moving to reactive systems. There are 5 use cases where Spring 5 based reactive framework can be used. 

Usecase 1 - Reactive Data Repository
Usecase 2 - Reactive Stream with Backpressure 
Usecase 3 - Reactive remote service orchestration
Usecase 4 - Reactive request input -No reading until reactive demand signalled from upstream
Usecase 5 - Reactive Data Ingestion with back pressure

Create POCs around each one of them and demonstrate these.

References: 
https://www.infoq.com/presentations/servlet-reactive-stack 
http://blog.avenuecode.com/reactive-streams-and-microservices-a-case-study
59.name: Spring 5 Reactive Framework - solve 5 use cases

60.description:
Build a static site for the HCL ERS Github org repo using GatsbyJS  
This site will hold information & statistics about our projects hosted on github  
Must have the ability to pull data from APIs, CMS content , flat files so that we can regenerate it when ever there is an update
60.name: Static Site for HCL ERS GITHUB

61.description:
Stenciljs is a web component compiler which gives the ability to create universal web components that can be used with any web framework like Angular JS, Angular, React etc. Create a POC that demonstrates the key to features and how is can be used with other frameworks

Visit : https://stenciljs.com/ for more information
61.name: StensilJS based web components

62.description: Stream Processing with Kafka,Flink and visualizing in InfluxDB and Graphana
62.name: Stream Processing with Kafka,Flink and visualizing in InfluxDB and Graphana

63.description:
This is a server based component which is inspired by the way Facebook uses the BigPipe architecture approach to stream the application fragments in parallel. You need to break you application into fragments or individual micro-frontends and it
•	Composes pre-rendered markup on the backend. This is important for SEO and fastens the initial render.
•	Ensures a fast Time to First Byte. Tailor requests fragments in parallel and streams them as soon as possible, without blocking the rest of the page.
•	Enforces performance budget. This is quite challenging otherwise, because there is no single point where you can control performance.
•	Fault Tolerance. Render the meaningful output, even if a page fragment has failed or timed out.
o	https://github.com/zalando/tailor           
o	https://github.com/tsnolan23/tailor-react-spa
Work on a POC related to getting Angular JS, React , Vue, Angular 6 working
63.name: Tailor Microfrontend Framework - POC

64.description:
Add in-app tamper detection ability the android application. 
This project aims at enabling the application to do self-check of possible tampers. 
This library provides additional mechanisms to detect tampers by reverse engineering process.
64.name: Tamper Detection - Android

65.description:
Testcontainers is a Java library that supports JUnit tests, providing lightweight, throwaway instances of common databases, Selenium web browsers, or anything else that can run in a Docker container.

https://www.testcontainers.org

Create a POC on the same
65.name: Test containers for JUnit tests

66.description:
For Image Uploader, the user will upload the image which will be stored on any server or database. After a successful upload it should show the preview of the image or error in case of error.   
##Plan 
- Drag & Drop (User can also upload image using drag & drop option) 
- Image Size (user defined size  like max 250 KB) 
- It should show the progress of the upload. 
- Image Format. (It should accept only valid image formats) 
- Use standard HTML5/CSS3 should work on all angular supported browser.
66.name: UI Challenge: Image Uploader with drag & drop option – Angular 2+

67.description: Build a web application using React.  Demonstrate state management  App must have more than one route, forms , api to get data
67.name: UI Redux State management based app (React)

68.description:
Material UI v1.0 is currently in beta , however will soon become the main supported version. 
There are many changes in terms of the current version and v1.0. 
This project involves upgrading the Gatsby project to use the latest material-ui https://material-ui-next.com/
68.name: Upgrade Gatsby project to use Material-UI v1

69.description:
A dashboarding application that allows a business user to manipulate charts and tables using voice based interaction. 
Hence a user can command the application to convert a column chart to pie chart, show a trend chart as a monthly trend instead of quarterly, etc.
69.name: Visualization with conversational UI

70.description:
Vuetify is the leading provider of material UI components for Vue JS. To add to that it provides OOTB generation templates so that you   can focus directly on the application being built.  
This project involves 
- Deciding a theme for the project 
- Building an application based on Vuetify 
- The application must be complete with tests and based on ES6/7 standards  https://vuetifyjs.com/en/getting-started/quick-start
70.name: VueJs + Vuetify Material UI sample

71.description:
Web Analytics is a cross cutting concern . It is often coupled with the web components resulting in rigid components which get affected by any change in the analytics toolkit . 

Also from a performance and testing point of view the web component should not need to know about how the events are sent across to the analytics server. Redux and Middleware pattern can be used to ensure that the web components simply fire an event of a user action and then forget about it. These events are then handled by the middleware asynchronously integrating with the analytics server. 
Build an analytics reference implementation using either Angular, Vue , React. You are also free to either build the analytics framework yourself or use some Opensource solution for the same.
71.name: Web Analytics based on Redux

72.description: Add Zipkin Open Tracing API support
72.name: Zipkin Open Tracing Support for nxplorerjs

73.description:
Write a generic script which can build a forecasting model when the predictors and response variable are provided. 
The script should be able to select the best parameters based and build the model. 
A scoring function should also be provided which outputs the result on an unseen dataset. 
Language used R or Python.
73.name: forecasting model

74.description:
ngx-rocket : Extensible Angular 5+ enterprise-grade project generator 
This is an Angular CLI extension which helps build a production grade , i18n ready , all batteries included Angular Project. This is used by companies like Schneider Electric and Thales .
Create a POC using this project generator
74.name: ngx-rocket Angular 5+ project generator

-LEDpAJGBdo9FlKZonhd.description: This use case requires accessing Azure Blob storage to extract data , transform and display it in a dashboard view with charts etc. Investigate and propose a solution of doing this the best way. One way is to access it via REST APIs . The link for the same is added
-LEDpAJGBdo9FlKZonhd.name: Azure Blob Storage access for SPA Apps

-LEISnFYbp0662HcYW7k.description: Large projects are generally divided into multiple sub applications, shared libraries, npm modules. But this can become very messy. Mono repo using Lerna or yarn workspaces it the way ahead for this. For Angular Nx Extensions is a good solution. Create a POC using either VueJS or ReactJS to demonstrate usage of a Mono Repo
-LEISnFYbp0662HcYW7k.name: Mono Repo for Large Enterprise Project

-LEmmkIZLRMDWyjbU1A-.description:
While we do move towards Material UI , it is a fact that a huge part of the industry is heavily dependent on Bootstrap , so we must have some exposure to it. ReactStrap (Bootstrap components for React) is a solution

Create a project that demonstrates the setup and usage of the same.
-LEmmkIZLRMDWyjbU1A-.name: React + Bootstrap

-LEsTplXQAH_8d6gU3Ry.description: Create a sample project in JSD for auto-remediation workflow for common IT tickets. Ex:  like Disk space issues, etc. When the tickets are generated from known sources, trigger the workflow to check the ticket type, source, perform auto-investigation and validation and trigger known remediation actions, for the issue.
-LEsTplXQAH_8d6gU3Ry.impact: preconfigured reference workflow for auto-ticketing and auto-remediation based on monitoring, useful for assisted troubleshooting and site reliability
-LEsTplXQAH_8d6gU3Ry.name: Create an auto-remediation workflow in JIRA Service Desk(JSD)

-LEsVsBLMqC_fYYNvhN2.description: Create DevOps tools as Helm packages to install as helm charts in Kubernetes environments. Choose any devops tools which are can be created as helm packages that can be installed in Kubernetes environments.
-LEsVsBLMqC_fYYNvhN2.name: Create DevOps tools as Helm packages to install as helm charts in Kubernetes environments

-LEyGDHdPQBQ7cH46TSf.description: Build an application to detect any incidents like fire accident, vehicle accident, improper machinery alignment, etc. by analyzing the video frames captured using the mobile camera. Using video processing and Core ML (iOS) and ML Kit (Android).
-LEyGDHdPQBQ7cH46TSf.name: Incident Detection

-LEyGfblEj4h43ZG0UuM.description: Build an application to analyze the audio input captured using the mobile device microphone and detect abnormal conditions. This can be applied in the defense to detect Gun Shot, in manufacturing units to identify malfunction of the machinery. Using audio processing and Core ML (iOS) and ML Kit (Android).
-LEyGfblEj4h43ZG0UuM.name: Audio Analysis

-LEyGot6gKZ_vAPKvuEU.description: Develop a mobile application to present digital twin, a virtual representation, of a hardware part. For example, in manufacturing, this can minimize the maintenance cost by facilitating predictive maintenance. This can be used in field service and many more. Using video processing and AR Kit (iOS) and AR Core (Android).
-LEyGot6gKZ_vAPKvuEU.name: Digital Twin

-LFGFl1S1hp6T6yV6lx4.description:
While each UI framework comes with its own SSR/Universal library (NextJS , NuxtJS, Angular Universal) , you need to have multiple solutions of SSR for different frameworks. This is where Razzle comes in and takes care of providing a common framework for SSR can supports React, Vue , Angular and more.
Explore this framework and create a solution where atleast two UI frameworks are used in one SSR app using Razzle.
-LFGFl1S1hp6T6yV6lx4.impact: SSR is a key aspect to high performance websites and we need a strategy and approach on this. Razzle can be one of the solutions we can explore and present our POV. Note: The current focus has all been on Client side apps , so this is important
-LFGFl1S1hp6T6yV6lx4.name: Universal JS App using Razzle for React,Vue,Angular

-LFMb6yNBoc4Nty70X1S.description:
CSS in JS is the here to stay and is the modern way of build the next generation React App. It has multiple benefits over separate CSS , including better testability , closer to the code, no global scoping issues, much more performant , DRY , no redundancy.
Styled Components is one of the leaders in CSS in JS due to the innovation it brings in and the fact it still supports pure CSS within JS.

Create a POC to demonstrate the same
-LFMb6yNBoc4Nty70X1S.impact: We need to have an approach and strategy around CSSinJS for our customers , so that we can propose the same to them. Styled components will help web apps to support high performance , SSR ready applications for React.
-LFMb6yNBoc4Nty70X1S.name: Styled Components with React (CSS in JS)

-LFQRwVDVx1NLh-WexGg.description:
Polly.JS is a standalone, framework-agnostic JavaScript library that enables recording, replaying, and stubbing HTTP interactions.

Keeping fixtures and factories in parity with your APIs can be a time consuming process. Polly alleviates this by recording and maintaining actual server responses without foregoing flexibility.
-LFQRwVDVx1NLh-WexGg.impact:
Record your test suite's HTTP interactions and replay them during future test runs for fast, deterministic, accurate tests.
Use Polly's client-side server to modify or intercept requests and responses to simulate different application states (e.g. loading, error, etc.).
-LFQRwVDVx1NLh-WexGg.name: Polly.JS based deterministic testing of the UI

-LFVSzIW8e567uWxyLQD.description:
Apollo Server 2.0 RC is out and comes with the next generation features which are tailored the GraphQL server usage patterns and provides more efficient ways of doing errors, logging, connecting to different downstream systems, caching. It also introduces a concept of Data Sources which can cater to downstream REST APIs or Microservices in a more natural way. 

Upgrade / Explore and demonstrate the findings in your project
-LFVSzIW8e567uWxyLQD.impact: Its critical that we upgrade and move towards v2 as most of the GraphQL Ecosystem around Node JS and Apollo (both backend and frontend) are likely to move in the coming months. Otherwise the existing solutions will be obsolete soon.
-LFVSzIW8e567uWxyLQD.name: Apollo Server 2.0 Upgrade for Next Generation NodeJS GraphQL Servers

-LG_0AWfNM2TPEmIV1K7.description: Break an existing monolithic application to multiple services
-LG_0AWfNM2TPEmIV1K7.impact: It will help business to quickly migrate their legacy/monolith application to microservice based architecture
-LG_0AWfNM2TPEmIV1K7.name: Microservice Challenge : Migration - Break the Monolith

-LH7ebanmevp3EdTfHoF.description: While MobX is available for other frameworks like Angular , it is best known in the React context. While the defacto standard for state management has been redux , however due to the extra complexity it adds to the projects it becomes difficult to first of all get started and then make sure the entire team understands how to use it. This is where MobX fits in and provides an alternative way of building a state management solution . Given that it hides a lot of the complexity, adaptability is much higher. Create a project that can demonstrate the basic functionality on this framework in a real life use case.
-LH7ebanmevp3EdTfHoF.impact: When presenting solutions to any customer , this question of using MobX vs Redux will come up. So it is important we have samples to show case both . This will help us convenience the end customer on what options to choose based on the use case.
-LH7ebanmevp3EdTfHoF.name: MobX UI State management for React

-LHCZSpkjUK1o8nf9Ilt.description:
While most of our solutions are around Client Side rendering , one area which we are weak or have no experience is server side rendering. 
Create a sample where you are using server side renderings using Next.JS , UI state management (Redux/Mobx/ Apollo Client) , Styling (Css Modules/ Styled Components) , API based data sources and demonstrate the difference in performance on both SSR and Client side rendering (which means the app should be runnable both as a client app and a server side all)
-LHCZSpkjUK1o8nf9Ilt.impact: For any web based solution for clients requiring server side rendering experience , this will serve as a great show case item as well as be able to use this for any RFP solutions.
-LHCZSpkjUK1o8nf9Ilt.name: Server Side Rendering for React

-LHCpxB4ZD1_zrIuavfJ.description: While we have many samples for Angular and React, VueJS is something we haven't focused on. Build a complete reference application with state management, pwa, styling. This should be reference app that can be showcased when required.
-LHCpxB4ZD1_zrIuavfJ.impact: VueJS is the most popular web framework, closely followed by React. We need a complete reference app to showcase our profeciancy.
-LHCpxB4ZD1_zrIuavfJ.name: VueJS reference app

-LHHt2pW9DPUA5D4cphK.description: Create ansible, cloud formation templates for automated installation and configuration of Sensu server, sensu client and checks for monitoring server, cloud , containers.
-LHHt2pW9DPUA5D4cphK.name: Create Infra as Code templates for automated installation and configuration of Sensu server, sensu client and checks for system, cloud , containers.

-LHbMn7WTfd664EpIZ1M.description:
mobx-state-tree is a state container that combines the simplicity and ease of mutable data with the traceability of immutable data and the reactiveness and performance of observable data.

It brings the best of both Redux and Mobx into one framework. Create a POC/Sample app that explores all the features of this framework including async calls, middleware, tests,time travel etc.
-LHbMn7WTfd664EpIZ1M.impact: MobX State Tree is a very compelling solution which is very powerful yet much simpler to incorporate. This is an important aspect to look as the end customers will ask for the best alternatives to Redux .
-LHbMn7WTfd664EpIZ1M.name: MobX State Tree - state management solution

-LHgmBu7hk1fYCuGutz3.description:
Gatsby v2 Beta is out and comes with the latest updates  and performance improvements including upgrade to React 16, Webpack 4, Babel 7. 

Upgrade the existing gatsby-demo-app to v2 , so that we can continue to leverage Gatsby and its framework in future as well.
-LHgmBu7hk1fYCuGutz3.impact:
Gatsby v1 is great but moving forward we will need to upgrade to take advantage of the new features and performance improvements. Also moving forward v1 will be deprecated and maintenance will become an issue.

This is a good showcase for CMS integration with Web UI
-LHgmBu7hk1fYCuGutz3.name: Gatsby v2 upgrade for ers-hcl.github.io

-LHrQEq0L70LbJqbcCCp.description:
While Selenium remains a main stay in most larger enterprises , Cypress.io and TestCafe offer much more agile and promising solutions to implement e2e tests.

Create a POC which covers both Cypress.io and TestCafe . Create a github project and a related white paper on the approach, findings and comparision of the same. (Bonus - If you can also add Selenium to the mix that will make it even more appealing)
-LHrQEq0L70LbJqbcCCp.impact: While we are spending a lot of focus of the newer web frameworks there is a need to also look at the e2e frameworks. While the percentage of tests we write are the smallest as compared to integration and unit tests, we need to make sure these are very efficient in running, developing and maintaining. This is where non Selenium options have cropped up and we need to have these in our technology porfolio.
-LHrQEq0L70LbJqbcCCp.name: Cypress.io vs TestCafe

-LIoJ8U7ZecIo9P56NDD.name: Discovery platform which will discover all systems connected and will monitor those systems with set of metrics

-LJNQw85UahMJV38U_9h.description: Unite the service using API Gateway and implement inter process communication
-LJNQw85UahMJV38U_9h.impact: It will help business to quickly migrate their legacy/monolith application to microservice based architecture
-LJNQw85UahMJV38U_9h.name: Microservice Challenge : Migration - Unite the Services

-LNf3gLUvsxAq9SS5rWu.description: Test Driven development and integration testing needs for microservices requires to be well planned out , so that we are able to test locally as well as on different deployment environments. Cucumber with Spring Boot provides a good combination to achieve the same. Create a reference implementation which provides all details of how to setup and create Spring Boot integration tests with Cucumber
-LNf3gLUvsxAq9SS5rWu.impact: Cucumber tests in combination with WireMock , Spring Profiles, Swagger and API contracts can be help in reduction of the overall test development effort by ~30-40% (when done in the traditional way) . This is due to the high reusability , productivity and maintainability of these tests.
-LNf3gLUvsxAq9SS5rWu.name: Microservices Testing using BDD Cucumber

-LNf4ljSAsTGNME0faEZ.description: TDD is a critical piece of any microservice development and often team struggle to get started. Create a reference implementation along with the process of implementing the same for Spring Boot based microservices
-LNf4ljSAsTGNME0faEZ.impact: TDD is a critical piece of any microservice development and often team struggle to get started. This can help teams implement tests correctly in the first instance itself.
-LNf4ljSAsTGNME0faEZ.name: TDD Reference implementation for Spring Boot microservices

-LNsM-jGY8OCGOPMpNHx.description: Microservices framework to handle high volume of events  more than 1Million per hour or more that is deployment agnostic
-LNsM-jGY8OCGOPMpNHx.impact: This is for a RFP for leading medical device manufacturer valued more than US $20M
-LNsM-jGY8OCGOPMpNHx.name: Workflow solution for high volume of events

-LNxbvmzKdLM6G8cq53Q.impact: High, Can be applied to multiple use cases
-LNxbvmzKdLM6G8cq53Q.name: NLP - Creating TF-IDF models for Topic Modelling
